website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive ergonomic mouse that boasts nearly two years of use with two AAA batteries, it's smaller than a trackball version for increased portability.
pros: Those who want a more traditional type of mouse but with better ergonomics will find this a good compromise
Multiple color options and an "idle" function to prolong battery life – as well as a flashing light indicating low battery power – round out the package
cons: Can feel a bit small for larger hands
some users wish the mouse had storage for the USB Nano receiver

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason (actually several) why this thing is cheap...
customer_reviews.text: The wireless receiver is difficult to remove from its holster. When I first went to insert the batteries, the thin plastic part of the top of the compartment snapped, though it was able to close securely. After testing on two different computers, one with Windows and the other with MacOS, this mouse has an effective wireless range of about 2 feet. Anything beyond that causes the cursor to jump around the screen. And finally to add insult to injury, I can't return it for a refund. Spend a little more money, and buy a wireless mouse from a reputable brand, such as Logitech or Microsoft.
customer_reviews.author: saturnotaku

customer_reviews.title: warranty and/or return policy is missing or unclear: sorry i purchased
customer_reviews.text: this is low cost item and i can suffer the loss if it fails to give reasonable service. i will be more careful next time and make sure that an item is returnable and/or has a "real" warranty. there is a manufacture's warrant card enclosed but the site doesn't exist!!
customer_reviews.author: Gaylethe

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: Update: I DID love it. Right up until it stopped working 6 months later. I didn't use it often, but one day it flashed red battery light. I replaced the batteries. Now if I turn it on it still flashes the red battery light and doesn't work. I tried yet another set of batteries, nothing.... Too late to return. Great wireless mouse. I bought one a few years ago that I liked, but it wore out. I bought this one, took it out of the box, put in the dongle, DONE. It works great and feels great. I had medium to large woman's hands and it feels great. I would recommend this to any of my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: DIY Southern Woman of a Certain Age

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is excellent
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does not work. It is defective. When turned on the arrow goes on its own and just makes a square on the screen. Cannot be controlled. I am impressed with the company though, it was delivered fast and was what was advertised. It is just defective, According to Amazon it is not returnable so I am left with a useless thing I cannot use and also out of my money that I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Carole

customer_reviews.title: For small hands, casual use, not programmable, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: NOT my daily mouse, for an extra Dell Windows 7 laptop I keep in the dining room. PROS - Inexpensive, for small hands, wireless, great customer service CONS - No mouse drivers, so can't program functions. Depending on software, sometimes the back/forward side works, sometimes it doesn't. A little too big to place in a slim laptop bag. The area where the USB is housed isn't covered so you can get dirt and dust inside. Must click on mouse to wake it up. My daily mouse is Logitech M510 which love, but I love, but costs more at $23. I've had it 6 years, purchased on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Le Jambon

customer_reviews.title: Short life span
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a wireless mouse where I lost the receiver. Worked great for 3 weeks then died indicating the batteries were bad. Replaced the 2 lithium batteries, that read 1.7 volts each on a volt meter, with fresh alkaline batteries. The mouse indicated they were bad also and would not connect to the receiver or computer. Since they were shipped from a 3rd party, Amazon says they can't be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: This is he 4th one I have bought. I really like how the new version has a slot to contain the USB module so you don't have to keep it in your ;laptop. I am afraid that sooner or later I will bust that on accident because it sticks out and possibly damage my computer..... BUT these work real well. This is the 4th one I have bought (because I just bought another laptop for my wife's craft work) All thumbs up from me on this item. NOTE: I buy all my products with my own money. I receive No Discounts either. My reviews are honest evaluations of any product I buy from Amazon,,,, and on other sites as well.
customer_reviews.author: N8ACUTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Great color and great feel
customer_reviews.text: I have long fingers and average size width hands so this mouse works good for me. I love the color and the small usb connection. It has an on and off switch and those wonderful side buttons to go back and forth on your pages. The scroll works evenly and easily and the left and right buttons move with barely any effort. I find the slight curve of the buttons perfect to prevent fatigue and the movement is very easy and fluid on most surfaces. One of the best mouses I've used, and I've been using computers since the 80's when they used 5" floppies.
customer_reviews.author: Sharie Breihan-Groot

customer_reviews.title: Works great... until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised right out of the box. It gets the job done nicely but my absolute favorite feature is the built in storage for the USB dongle since I had ordered this because I couldn't find the USB adapter for my old mouse. Update: 6 months later, the mouse has stopped working. The low battery indicator comes on, I have replaced the batteries multiple times with fresh alkaline batteries with no luck. Trying to visit the URL listed in the instructions for a warranty claim redirects me to a different domain name with an online store. Time is money so it's easier for me to buy a new one than try to jump through hoops to get service.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Fox

customer_reviews.title: No longer quality mice
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work upon receiving. Tecknet will only honor warranties on purchases made through them and not through Amazon and I did not test the product within the 30 day return window. It’s my second Tecknet mouse and the first one worked great for two years before going out. This model was newer and supposedly better but I guess not. Buyer beware. I tried swapping batteries, unplugging the Bluetooth usb plug and trying it in multiple USB ports in my laptop. The power indicator light shows nothing when flipping the power switch.
customer_reviews.author: David Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Good dependable mouse
customer_reviews.text: I decided to venture to another brand after I noticed the the unified receivers for my logitech devices tend to be dying sooner and sooner lately. After looking at mice just based on reviews, it caught my attention that this mouse was reviewed higher than the comparable Logitech and Microsoft ones. I figured that it was worth a shot and this mouse works as well, if not better than the ones I have had before. Sleep mode doesn't seem to work very well so I just turn it off when not using it for a long time or if I plan to throw it in my bag. Really happy with it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Like the product, hate the warranty registration
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for about a week and it ticks all of my boxes. Easy to use, wheel rotates easily, cord-free. In fact, this mouse probably has features that I will never use. The only negative: registering the product for its warranty was a bit of a pain in the butt. Overall, I'm pleased with the product. I accidentally ordered two, but I'm happy enough with the product to not return the 2nd. Realistically, most people don't register for warranties (and at this price point I'd probably just buy another mouse) so I wouldn't let the cumbersome website prevent you from making this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Fits smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse. I bought both this TekNet Pro and the TeckNet Classic 2.4G. They seems to work the same, but the only difference is the size. Pro great for smaller hands and Classic for larger hands. For both, the USB sensor fits neatly, magnetically in underside of the mouse for easy carriage. The mouse goes to sleep, or switch off to extend battery life. So far I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ishmael

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to.
customer_reviews.text: Our kitten knocked my trackmouse off the desk when I wasn't around. The ball fell out and I'm guessing she started batting it around the house because I can't find it! Oh well...the device was 6 years old so I decided to try something different. I settled on this mouse and second day in I'm very pleased. I plugged the receiver in, put batteries in the mouse, and it worked perfectly. I don't use it for gaming so I can't comment on that. Anyway, I could have spent a LOT more on a mouse, but for ten bucks I'm exceedingly pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cordless Mouse with Convenient Features
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Dad who was tired of dealing with his old corded mouse (on a Windows 7 laptop). He loves it! This mouse has been used daily for the past week with no connection or construction issues. The DPI button is really nice in dialing in the amount of cursor movement to mouse movement ratio. One feature that we found to be really ingenious was the magnetic connection between the USB dongle and the bottom part of the mouse. He is a fan and would recommend this mouse to a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: bry

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Received the mouse in a plain box with minimal instructions. Put in the Amazon AAA batteries and the mouse hooked up with my laptop Lenovo computer without a problem. Just remember to turn the slider on the bottom to ON. Any problems hooking up are probably related to Bluetooth, which can be remedied most of the time by pushing the little button right behind the mouse wheel on top of the unit. If not, you may have to open up the little gear icon on the windows computer program and look for answers in the system set up.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Dale DanielTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Scroll is nearly silent but the clicking is pretty loud
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is very responsive. I type fast and mouse fast too so I like that it keeps up. I also like the scrolling wheel, it feels good to grip on my finger and it is nearly silent! The color is pretty (purple) and it was easy to install with the USB port. The only thing I can't give it 5 stars for is because it clicks quite loudly! **** UPDATE**** I have had it happen several times where my finger has hit the back/forward button and messed me up with a form I was completing. :( So, I would not get one with that feature again as it's too easy to hit those by accident.
customer_reviews.author: recycle-it

customer_reviews.title: Loudest clicking mice I've ever heard
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One blue one purple. My husband playing solitaire drove me so crazy in just the two days he's had it,I play adventure games, and I've never been irritated by my own mouse clicks, but with this one I am. I came back and have a silent mouse overnight shipped. I'll be ordering me a silent mouse next. These things click loud enough to be heard on the moon. Even the aliens are griping because my husbands solitaire games clicking is driving them crazy! These may be cheap and pretty, but wow...that loud clicking!
customer_reviews.author: Cloud shadow

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected but it works
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is uncomfortably small, like a travel mouse. I thought it was full-size, because the photos show it with a hand and a laptop and it looks big. I should have paid more attention to the last one where it says 4". That said, it works. If it was a full-size mouse I would like it, but it's too small for me to use really comfortably. It's technically my fault for not seeing the dimension and thinking the photos were actual size, so I guess I'll just have to use it and be angry about it silently.
customer_reviews.author: Al S

customer_reviews.title: 1 * just for the policy not the product
customer_reviews.text: I received an empty package yesterday that was supposed to contain this mouse and although I realize that it was a mistake on Amazon's part all I wanted was for this to be replaced. However the manufacturer won't allow replacements. so Amazon had to refund me and now I have to reorder a different mouse. Because of the trouble this caused I will not reorder this one. Maybe the manufacturer can adjust their refund and replacement policy because on occasion people do you have to replace these.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Formanek

customer_reviews.title: Third one I've bought because they work so well for a basic wireless mouse uses
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much from an inexpensive mouse, but my first one of these turned out to be really good. So much so that I have bought two more over time (all different colors, of course). The good: works great, decent build and ergonomics, battery lasts a long time. The bad: it's not heavy, so if you like a mouse with some weight, this isn't it. Also, receiver isn't in the best location and can get lost if you don't take care. That said, I haven't had any real issues with the negative aspects, so really I can only say good things here. If you're looking for a solid, reliable and inexpensive wireless mouse, then this is it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Very responsive little mouse
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an earlier purchase of a wireless mouse that died after 2 months (and no, it wasn't the battery). What attracted me first was the color, followed by the shape. This shape tends to work the best for my hand, as I have arthritis and carpal tunnel and I am a technical writer by profession. This mouse is VERY responsive. In fact, after using it, the Logitech wireless mouse I use on my own computer seems sluggish in comparison. I may buy another one of these to replace that one. Overall, I'm very pleased with this purchase. Of course, Amazon service was super-fast - gotta love Prime!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Y.

customer_reviews.title: Not well made and not returnable
customer_reviews.text: The seller does not allow returns through Amazon. I went through Amazon chat to request a refund anyway, because the battery compartment door is defective. It's made to squeeze and hinge open, but it will not un-latch unless I pry it with a tool. Considering it's a small plastic door, this will break it after one or two battery changes are needed. It is also too small and narrow to be considered 'ergonomic' - it's about halfway between a standard size and a laptop size.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not a good mouse
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the color is nothing like the photo - it's kind of a dull purple/grey, and it's actually kind of ugly. This coming from a person who loves the color purple. It's not shiny at all like the photo - just a dull color. Additionally, the batteries do not last very long - I do not use my laptop often - maybe a few hours a week, and the batteries are already dying. I've managed to get them to limp along by changing them around every time, but I shouldn't have to do that - it's quite annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: great for carpel funnel
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used this product for gaming or used the sleep mode feature (that I’m aware of) . But I’ve had this product for a while and it has the original batteries in it. I use my computer daily as a college student; setting the mouse up is as easy as popping in the USB. I have carpel tunnel so this is a great option to reduce pain, tightness, & tenderness. If you don’t know about the bend it’s of an ergonomic mouse I would do research! I was using a regular mouse for years and now that I have the ergonomic mouse it’s all I use at work and home! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Nice wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.text: The mouse fits nicely into my hand. The wheel in the center has a rubber coating. It is moves easily and is smooth. My thumb rests nicely in the in groove. It has a rubber grip on the thumb side. The size is good and it is comfortable to use. There is a slot in the bottom of the mouse to hold the receiver. I think that is a nice feature, if you travel. You don't have to worry about losing the receiver, if you take your pc in and out of a bag. You don't have to worry about accidently bumping the receiver out.
customer_reviews.author: jess374

customer_reviews.title: Went bananas in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Just trying to type this without making a mistake is what my entire day is like on the computer. The mouse moves independently and highlights paragraphs on it's own volition. If i have to back up a space I have to start over as the cursor jumps all over the place. So. Another piece of garbage for the already too full land fill. I'm so tired of things made to be replaced yearly. I miss the old days of MADE IN AMERICA.You never had to worry about this. It's sad.
customer_reviews.author: Becky LaGrandeur

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I have used Tecknet mice for several years. Others here also use them. This one is even improved over previous models with more dpi and battery life and the buttons have a softer feel to them the as well--more comfortable. We like that the mouse turns off automatically when not in use to preserve battery. It is the only model I buy for general use. Highly recommended. Purchased latest as a new grad gift based on good past experience.
customer_reviews.author: count_zero

customer_reviews.title: Not made left handed people
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually have issues with most "Mice" but this one is just not really made to be used with either hand. I don't change the configuration (I use a standard right handed mouse with my left hand) but this is definitely ergonomically for a right handed user. The two button on the left hand side of the mouse are just in the way for a leftie and it's not very comfortable. This is by no means the fault of the maker, just my fault for not investigating more. Overall it functions pretty well (ex: response is good). Sadly I will be giving this to someone right handed. off to look for one that is universal!
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: Went through laundry and still works!
customer_reviews.text: Get this; so, my wife picks up the tablecloth and does not see this mouse, so, she washes the tablecloth and the mouse and runs them through the dryer. This mouse comes out nice and clean with a fresh cleaned cloths smell... AND IT STILL WORKED!!!!! Why cant my cell phone be like this mouse; when my wife washed the iPhone it didn't work (smelled nice, but didn't work). I'm sad because the USB piece for this mouse broke. Have the mouse but, cant use it now. GREAT MOUSE FOR THOSE WITH A WIFE THAT LIKES TO WASH ELECTRONICS!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Julian Papp

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, turns off when not in use
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I have very large hands and this mouse fits me comfortably. I love that it turns off after a short time not in use because I'm a teacher and I'm back and forth to the computer all day long. The roller ball is quick but accurate, the buttons click quickly, and it glides well. Super easy to hook up - just plug in the USB, and it works immediately. I will recommend this mouse to everyone I know looking for a wireless mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Konnie K.

customer_reviews.title: Worked initially but failed later....
customer_reviews.text: One year after purchase, the scroll wheel is missing scrolls and it's very difficult to use to scroll one page at a time... UPDATE 5/3/2017 - Customer care contacted me after this review and offered to replace the defective product. Really appreciate that the company took time to ensure customer satisfaction.. I'll provide another update to this review after testing the replacement product. UPDATE 6/2/2017 - I received the new product and it appeared to be brand new and in excellent condition. It is working as expected. Thanks for addressing the concern and resolving my issue on priority.
customer_reviews.author: Raks

customer_reviews.title: MEH
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, I know most reviewers love this thing but it's not working for me. Why you ask? Because the usability design is terrible. Two main issue: 1) the USB transceiver is almost impossible to pull out of the hole in the bottom of the mouse. Don't cut your fingernails, you'll need them to get this out (although you will then likely break them. 2) The On/Off switch is really difficult to move. Again if you don't have fingernails, you can't do this at all. Functionally it seems fine once everything is plugged in, etc. But you will be annoyed by how difficult they made this to use.
customer_reviews.author: A. Price

customer_reviews.title: Slippery / Hard to Hold
customer_reviews.text: Photos appear to be a matt finish. This is high gloss finishm which feels cheap (well... it is, let's be fair). Left side is ruberized, but not right, which is slippery, without enough of an edge get a very good hold. Somewhat Difficult to grip / pick up. For the price, not bad, but definitely not great either. Noted also, that 2x AAA batteries hold less energy than a single AA. Should have bought the VictSing for about the same price. GF has one of them and I like it better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Perry

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GET FOR A MAC
customer_reviews.text: Despite the headline saying it's Mac compatible (which is technically true, you can use the cursor) you CANNOT change the button functions at all on a mac. This is hidden down in small print on the product page. But is very deceptive marketing. If you list a product as compatible in the headline, you shouldn't have to search high and low to see what "compatible" actually means and to find out you can't use main functions of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Hoth

customer_reviews.title: Once all the problems are fixed I expect it to be good
customer_reviews.text: Hard to write a review from something that I can't seem to get to work. The first one just plain didn't work. The replacement doesn't work when the batteries are installed all the way. It will work if one partially removes the rear battery almost all the way out of the unit. The company is currently working to remedy the problem to my satisfaction which is good. Couldn't get either mouse to work. A bad design flaw in the battery compartment. Requested and received a refund. I will try another company. Sorry this did not work out.
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Susan Nulf

customer_reviews.title: Love my mouse but now my second one has broken within 5 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse a couple years ago when I got my new laptop, and I loved it so much that when that one broke I bought it again, though this one has been great too, 5 months later it has decided to die too. Saying brand new batteries have no charge and is flickering across the screen when I try to move it. Tried multiple batteries and removing and reinstalling the mouse. It's a shame because it's a wonderful little mouse but seems mine has given up the ghost so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Shell Bug

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel, small, "clicky"
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than expected, but it fits my hand decent enough. I wouldn't recommend if you use your mouse for a long length of time, but it's nice to use occasionally when I have more work than I feel like handling on the touchpad. The click is VERY clicky. This is NOT a quite mouse. It's decent for the price, would travel well, but it could be worth it to spend a little more and get something that doesn't feel as cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna P

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse, but the cursor is shaky - NOT for gaming
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great for the price. The battery life is pretty good, the feel is very ergonomic, and the trackball is easy to use. The connection distance isn't great, but as long as you computer is relatively close it should be fine. The main issue with this is that the when using the trackball the cursor is shaky - in other words, if you try to move smoothly, it is a little difficult. This makes it absolutely terrible for pretty much any sort of gaming; it's not precise, and if you use it to move the camera you might get sick from the shakiness. Otherwise a great mouse though.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Meggs

customer_reviews.title: It was good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse a year and a month ago and it was great while it was working. It's light-weight, and responsive. Exactly what I need when I do 8 to 12 hour work shifts on my laptop. As long as I remembered to turn the mouse off, the batteries would last for months on end. Recently the mouse has been not registering my clicks the first time and seems to be losing connection. It will lag behind where I moved it, then jump to the correct position on my screen. I really liked this mouse, but I will have to get a different one that will last longer than a year.
customer_reviews.author: RyokiF

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about a year and a half before left click stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Worked well while it lasted. I liked the USB plug in so I could easily use with any computer without setting up the Bluetooth, although I worried I might lose it through sheer clumsiness. It stayed well inside the holder of the mouse though and it was small enough that I left it plugged into my computer. I only changed the battery once I think in frequent use over the year and a half I had it. Then the main button just stopped working so I had to replace it. The exterior still looked quite good, and I will admit I dropped it a time or two so it could be on me. Not bad for ten bucks really.
customer_reviews.author: Helen S

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is wonderful. I've had it for a while now and use it frequently (sometimes accidentally leaving it on, even overnight) and I have yet to need to change the battery. It works well and is very responsive. The only thing that I could even remotely consider a "negative" is that the receiver is somewhat difficult to remove from the actual mouse to plug into your computer. The compartment is magnetic, which I think is good to make sure you don't lose the receiver, but that can make for a lot of fumbling around trying to plug in your mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great shape, like better than brand names, more accurate - but requires two 3AAA bateries
customer_reviews.text: Important: the TeckNet Pro 2.4G Ergonomic Wireless Optical Mouse requires TWO AAA batteries - would have preferred one AA battery, but the mouse is better shaped than Logitech of Microsoft mice I have used. This mouse is much more accurate than other mice I have used. It's excellent, but you will need two AAA batteries. This should have been mentioned in the description. But I like it so much I am keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: trengdan37

customer_reviews.title: Died after 6 months - not ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse in early March and use it nearly daily. It was great until yesterday (early Sept) when it completely failed. I changed the batteries, turned it on/off, unplugged/replugged the USB, tried a different port, rebooted my computer - nothing. It has never been dropped or misused in any way, so I expected a much longer life. I will not repurchase and would advise others to stay away as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer K.

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless mouse you can buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a Technet wireless mouse for 3 years, and recently thought it was becoming sluggish, so I purchased another (turns out it wasn't the mouse, but my laptop) Its simply the best mouse I've ever owned! I love that I don't have to turn it off in between uses, and the battery power is amazing! It feels good in your hand, scrolls easily. I'm happy to have 2 and will pass my old one on to my granddaughter for her laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: Mouse batteries not lasting.
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this item, it was due to the batteries were supposed to last a very long time, but they aren't. The information about the mouse isn't correct. I love the mouse, I don't love that the batteries are not lasting as long as they said on the site when I bought the mouse. I don't want to have to return this item due to getting out of the house. I have been sick not able to get out. the places aren't open to the public right now.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Elton

customer_reviews.title: Bought my second one
customer_reviews.text: I love the ergonomics of this mouse. I have long fingers and typically buy a women's medium-size glove. It took me a while to get used to which button did what on the first one, but once I got there, I loved it. Unfortunately, it got spilled on and gave up, so I bought a new one. The new one has deeper grooves for fingers and I find it more comfortable than the last one I bought years ago.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Great wireless mouse when it wants to work.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great when it wants to work. When this mouse is working, it is very responsive and fits perfect in my hand. I have this mouse hooked up to my deskstop and it seems like every other day it stops working. I continously have to turn off and unplug the doggle from pc so that it starts working again. My pc placed under my desk so i beleive it might have some interferance. I since have swithed to a logitech and have had no connectivity issues. I gave this mouse to a coworker who has his pc placed ontop of his desk and he has had no issues so far. Overall great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: susie alcantar

customer_reviews.title: Works O.K. after almost 4 weeks but battery compartment cover is flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Have been using 3.5 weeks with no operating problems but the battery compartment cover is poorly designed. There is a depressed area in front of the cover, apparently so you can get your fingernail under the front edge of the cover to pry upward and remove the cover. However, that front edge is a thin strip which breaks easily when you pry up on it. I have 3 of these mice and that strip has broken on 2 of them (I super glued them to repair). The battery compartment and it's cover need to be redesigned, perhaps a sliding cover like so many others have.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Match
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mouse for mauve colored Lenovo Ideapad 330 and they match so perfectly you would have thought they came together Additionally, love the fact there's an opening in the bottom of the mouse to store the USB Port (clever idea). The mouse works perfectly (buttons and scroll wheel). I love it and would recommend to anyone especially someone with the mauve colored Lenovo Ideapad 330.
customer_reviews.author: CreatedBy1

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse and smooth grip
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy with this mouse. It is very smooth and light and the grip is very pleasant. Although the range did not work (20M) as indicated. I used new batteries and several attempts pretty much does not respond after 7 meters or about 21 feet. Not sure why but, that was not the main reason I bought the mouse. I use multiple mice on several devices simultaneously and this one stands out (second from the right in the photo). Replaced the laser logitech which I paid $60 for and this one ...has absolutely nothing short. Definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Touraj Behmand

customer_reviews.title: This mouse worked great for about a week but it now unusable
customer_reviews.text: This mouse worked great for about a week but it now unusable. I travel for work and needed a new, larger and ergonomic mouse. The size of the mouse was perfect light weight. That being said, i can no longer use the mouse due to one of the side buttons malfunctioning. The side-button has some type of short in it and is constantly triggering whatever page i am on to go "back" even when my hand is removed from the mouse. Very disappointed with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but drains batteries!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works very well and enables smooth movements, but it kills batteries way too quickly! Within just days of receiving it, the new batteries that were in it were basically dead. I turned the mouse off, pulled the batteries out and put them back in, and it worked again. However, this has become the ritual every single time I use the mouse. Highly inconvenient. I will likely replace this mouse with a Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen A.Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: While the price is certainly a major factor, this mouse only lasted a few months. We wrote to the sellers asking them to honor their warranty. One month later and no response. So there you have it. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Toby Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not amazing, but functional. Got one of these for use at work, because I hate their mice. This mouse feels pretty cheap and light, but it's comfortable in the hand. Once in a while it'll do this weird thing where the mouse will move quickly to the left for a few seconds (and be stuck on the left side of the screen for a second or so). Not a deal breaker because it's pretty infrequent, but still weird. It also chews through battery pretty quickly. Or the battery indicator is just busted.
customer_reviews.author: Asa Price

customer_reviews.title: NOT returnable!!!!!! :(
customer_reviews.text: Really annoyed- this turned out to be not a good fit for my hand, I went to return it and to my surprise, it is not returnable. So frustrating. Thank goodness I didn't spend much on it- I gave it to a friend. But apparently Prime doesn't necessarily mean returnable, so I'll have to double check every thing I purchase from now on- because I do not buy online unless it's free returns!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Mouse is overly sensitive
customer_reviews.text: Mouse will eat through battery power if you leave them in, even though mouse is turned off. Connects quickly and well. Mouse is very sensitive and does this annoying auto scroll without actually being activated. Despite attempting to modify settings it does not help. Do not recommend for business, professional presentations or surfing the internet. Really only purchased for quick mobile work station changes.
customer_reviews.author: A Gilded Jade

customer_reviews.title: Warning!!!! Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: I have tried multiple brand new batteries and the mouse does not work. Had other people look at it and they all agree it does not work. Tried to return but you can not return the mouse. Also, tried to find a way to contact the seller to no avail. So much for the QC sticker on the bottom of the mouse. Do not waist your money! Update: the same day I posted my review the seller contacted me. They offered a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Arcement

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your time or money, this mouse does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I would give this mouse zero stars if it was an option. I ordered this mouse hoping that it would be a good accessory for my HP Zbook laptop. Right out of the box, this mouse would not turn on after charged batteries were installed. Frustrated, I ordered a replacement, thinking it was a fluke. New mouse came, same issue: did not even turn on, right out of the box. I did all of the basic troubleshooting, tried different brand new batteries, adjusted power management settings on the computer, toggled then on/off switch, etc. etc. NOTHING! It makes me angry that precious natural resources were consumed on the manufacture and shipping of a completely worthless piece of trash.
customer_reviews.author: M. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mouse
customer_reviews.text: When my 6 yr old technet finally died on me I decided to order another one. I use this in the office for work. It feels slightly wider than the old one but whatever. They removed that one feature where the mouse sleeps after a few mins of inactivity, which I was kind of sad about but I’ll live without it. This is probably the best mouse you can buy for $12. I would argue that this mouse feels better than my $100 Logitech that I use for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mouse
customer_reviews.text: My old mouse decided not to work anymore so I was in need of a new one but didn't want to spend a lot of money. After searching and reading reviews I decided to try this one out. So far it's been great. Moves smoothly. It's got a nice ergonomically hand grip on it and the thumb area is rubbery. It connects quickly and goes into sleep mode when not in use. Definitely happy with the purchase thus far.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Solid wireless mouse for a great price. PROS: + Nice color options + Sleek design and comfortable grip + Durable enough to have taken quite a few falls onto tile!! + Large side buttons to go forward and backward when web browsing CONS: - Flimsy plastic cover for batteries (bottom of mouse); the small thin bridge cracked and snapped when lifting it to change batteries. Doesn't negatively affect usage, was just surprised it broke so easily. *Should be noted it is designed for right hand usage CONCLUSION: Great mouse. Definitely can't beat it in terms of quality and price. Ended up buying 2 for myself in different colors and 1 as a gift!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kraj

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse in May of 2018. It was working fine until 11/3/18 but then it started malfunctioning with erratic scrolling. This happened on a night that my homework was due and I could not use the mouse to scroll my e-texbook. I tried to update the driver, but the newest driver was already installed. After trying everything else, I bought a new mouse at WalMart tonight and am now having no problems at all. Cheaper price too.
customer_reviews.author: 1970turtle

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, clicks nicely, comfortable and responsive. Sleep modes works well, just one click and its awake immediately. I really do love this, and the color is great! I have the "purple" one and its more a plum than a true deep purple, but it is still a great color, and works awesome!!! I have had it for over a month, and no complaints. I would totally buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: MsDove

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely awful. I purchased this Friday for my office computer get to work today set it all up just to have the mouse not turn on. I tried 3 different sets of batteries and still nothing. I tried to email the seller to request an exchange since it's not eligible for a refund. 10 minutes later received an email from Amazon telling me my email was undeliverable the email address didn't exist. What the heck! Just terrible. Going to contact Amazon cs this is shameful
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: For a right-handed user such as myself, the two buttons positioned directly above the thumb couldn't be in a worse place, unless you enjoy inadvertently bumping these very sensitive fellas and going somewhere you didn't intend. Happens routinely to me. Can't speak for others obviously, but I've got pretty big hands so I've got to handle this thing with kid's gloves, which is not what I want to worry about when I'm trying to accomplish things as quickly as possible.
customer_reviews.author: M. Standish

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s a little tighter / smaller than I anticipated, but it’s ok. I had a Microsoft sculpt that’s a little bigger and was the type of grip I was looking to match. The computer didn’t initially take to the new mouse’s usb insert. Had to shut down and restart. For the price it does what it’s supposed to do. I just wish it was a bit bigger and was more open to my hand shape.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: OK mouse, horrible battery life.
customer_reviews.text: Mouse feels fine in the hand and works well, just plug it in and within a few seconds it’s working perfectly. The main issue is battery life. Even with turning the mouse “off” when not using we are replacing batteries every couple weeks. At the rate we are replacing them fairly certain I could have bought a more expensive Logitech mouse with one year battery life and still come out ahead. I may still do that even though my return window has closed and still break even, it’s that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny F

customer_reviews.title: Ok, it's works
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mouse, especially for the price. It works. It's a little larger than I wanted. But to get what I really want I would have to spend at least 60 bucks. It's definitely not a full size (just returned a Logitech that was) I would call it medium size. I want another Gigabytes mouse, but Amazon only has the Bluetooth one. I included a picture so you can get a feel for the size. Edit/added. SELLER ( Hippidion.US.Store) refunded my $ and I didn't even ask for a refund.. Wow, you cant beat that kind of customer care!
customer_reviews.author: FIRE WITCH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mouse for Budget AND Quality!
customer_reviews.text: With the kids home for virtual school, my mouse quickly got swiped for my son's use, since it was smaller and worked well for his hand. I needed a quick and inexpensive replacement. This mouse has been exactly what I need working remotely. I've had no problems and have been very happy with quality and performance! Great budget alternative to more expensive brands!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: One of three doesn't work, and I can't request a replacement
customer_reviews.text: We have a purple mouse that we have used for several months and it has worked fine. I bought a red mouse and a gray mouse for some other computer systems. The red mouse works fine but the gray one doesn't. For some reason Amazon will allow me to return the red one, but won't let me return the gray one. I'm hopeful that someone will see this and send me another gray mouse because two of three have worked fine, and I'm not that upset that one doesn't work, but I'm very frustrated that I can't request a replacement through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey Deitch

customer_reviews.title: Eats Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I've had the mouse now for 4 days. On the second day, I replaced the once new batteries (2AAA) with another pair. Now I remind myself to turn the mouse off each and every time that I'm closing my laptop. I don't expect this mouse to last long. I've had the same brand Tecknet for my 2nd laptop. Wireless too. Without any issues. And one AA battery that's lasted 3 years now. I'm hoping I'll find the old style mouse and being rid of this high maintenance newer version
customer_reviews.author: Speedracer Girl

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the looks of this mouse. The color was spot on and it fits my hand perfectly. The problem is that it stops working at random times. I'm using it and it just stops. When I'm not using it I always turn it off so as not to drain the batteries. When I go to use it I have to shake it to get it to start working again even if I just stopped using it.
customer_reviews.author: Book Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Mouse doesn't work, very disappointed child...no returns??!
customer_reviews.text: Such a disappointment, our 7 year old bought this mouse with her own money and waited patiently for it to come in the mail only for it not to work. The light never comes on at the side of the mouse, and it doesn't register on the computer. We tried fresh batteries, it's just junk. Worst of all, the seller doesn't provide and return policy! Take your money someplace else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse but one point worth knowing!
customer_reviews.text: Here's the real deal. This is a great mouse no doubt. Works well, good range and functionality but ONE VERY IMPORTANT THING TO KNOW - The buttons are loud when you click. The reason I mention this is because I bought this for my laptop to be used in school and during class if I try multiple clicks it feels awkward. Don't want to take credit away from a wonderfully built mouse but please note that the clicks are loud - if you're okay with that you should definitely buy it. Sadly, this is not for me. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Dhruv

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice, lightweight and ergonomic feeling mouse. It has additional hot buttons on the side which is good for gaming and shortcuts in certain programs. Plug and play was nice and straight forward tested on windows 10 and chrome book worked perfectly. overall very happy with this purchase will be happy to buy more in the future when my older mouses fail.
customer_reviews.author: C. Goetsch

customer_reviews.title: For the price this is an excellent mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has everything I want at a great price. It stays pretty clean and its optical sensor tracks fine. My favorite part is the low battery indicator light that is easy to see. Battery life is great. For the price I can't fault anything about this purchase. I have never had one break so I assume it is durable even though it is very light. I bought 3.
customer_reviews.author: Blithe

customer_reviews.title: Really great mouse, really cheap
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying a bunch of mice lately for a variety of reasons. Some don't work well, some I've broken by dropping them. This is the first one in a long string that has been excellent. The battery life is great, I've dropped it 20+ times and it holds itself together, and I really like the way it looks and feels. If I had one tiny complaint, it's that the there are two kind of awkward buttons right by your thumb, and when your dog jumps up on you you might accidentally hit one of them and go back a page. But then you can just use the other and go forward right away, so no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J. Fleegle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Had my first one for at least two years if not longer. Only reason I had to buy a new one is I hit the USB connector in something while in my laptop and broke part of it off. Still Worked but decided I better not wait for the inevitable. I also get decent range with this as I walk around the room to teach and can still control the laptop while projecting.
customer_reviews.author: Jifinifer

customer_reviews.title: Hand Tastic
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse for small-sized hands. Quick response and so comfortable. eliminates fatigue. Can't provide feedback on gaming, haven't used it this way yet. Really like the purple color, not too bright. But you must turn the switch to off before putting it into your carrier. One nit, removing the usb is a tat difficult, but it certainly won't fall out and lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works well, not for working the entire day.
customer_reviews.text: Just ok mouse for my needs... I think it is too small for my hands... it is great to carry around in your bag, but not for everyday intensive use; definitely, not for working the entire day as it made my hand sore. The slot for the USB receiver is a little loose though so, be careful The overall construction is good quality and well made. Configuration/connection wise, it connects right away and works pretty well. What I miss is a couple functions that this mouse cannot provide - yes I know, it's cheap, what am I complaining about ? Recommended: yes (but not to work the entire day).
customer_reviews.author: alexdelara

customer_reviews.title: Quality Budget Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavily active laptop and overall computer user. ften 12+ hours a day. I have use the TeckNet brand of mouse for 3-4 years. This is a great product. The only thing that Ive had an issue with is the battery door cover popping off every once and a while. However this problem was easily solved with a small bit of scotch tape. Otherwise great product! Definitely would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: bbean

customer_reviews.title: A Winner
customer_reviews.text: This is a high quality mouse for a cheap price. It is in between large and small -- if you have a small hand you may find it bulky. But it is fast and accurate and allows you to make various pixel sensitivity settings. Two side buttons allow you to go forward or back a page without leaving your place. It also has an energy saving device - it shuts down after 8 seconds. But no worries - you won't even notice it starting up again because it comes to life as soon as you touch it. So far, this is a much better choice than the Logitechs.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Shoppin

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Serves its purpose but the color is off. The purple looks nice online but the actual mouse is more of a reddish/brownish purple. It doesn't always synch to my computer either. The USB is bulky so don't leave it in your laptop when it's not in use. Be careful with the USB when you put it back in the bottom of the mouse. Mine falls out easily. It's a poor design. My previous wireless mouse had it inside the battery compartment which endured it wouldn't get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Rascal

customer_reviews.title: NOT Actually Fully Mac Compatible.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon's product description, as well as the description on the manufacturer's website, claim that this device is fully compatible with Mac devices running up-to-date operating systems. This is not true: on Mac's, the side buttons that are supposed to trigger forward/backward responses on a browser are essentially non-functional. The manufacturer's s customer service support people were courteous but unequivocal in responding to my inquiries: this device is NOT actually fully compatible with the Mac OS. This, of course, leaves one with a regular wheel mouse, albeit a well built one that may be purple. If you buy this for a Mac and expect full functionality, you will be very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Obdictum

customer_reviews.title: GREAT mouse for ten dollars!!
customer_reviews.text: So... extremely responsive, perfect size and nice architecture. Man, for ten bucks, you can't go wrong! Batteries not included for that price, so I grabbed a cheap 4 pk of AAA's at the local grocery store and BAM! up and running. ZERO LAG. did i say no lag? Yep. Perfect. Thanks again Amazon for getting me something rather boring but much needed for a superbly affordable price😀
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Wheel mouse now goes up when I roll down...goes down when I roll up- sporadically.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on May1--> waited to review for 6 months but never made it that far. its not junk but a smidge above. I have replaced the batteries, moved the surface to different types, even talked gently to it...nothing worked. Still have this issue and it is progressively getting worse. This is my individual experience. Good Luck. update- 2 days after this review- mouse died completely. sigh.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: The alkaline battery is very good on this thing
customer_reviews.text: I've like too much this little thing, very responsive (without a mouse pad, wich is great), the battery, I haven't changed until today so very good until now, so for me is everything more than ok! I should buy more like 3 more because I love it! Bought jun/8 until today is everything fine, I never think on a possiblity to had a wireless mouse because the constant changes of batteries but this guy take my heart... Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joao Paulo Dias

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse, especially for the price. It seems solidly built and had some nice features. I like that where the thumb rests is rubberized, which is comfortable and makes a good grip. The auto sleep feature is great because I don't have to worry about switching it off to save the battery and the "battery low" light is also a nice plus. Great mouse!
customer_reviews.author: G and J

customer_reviews.title: Great little mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mouse! My thumb rests comfortable on the side on a non-slip grip pad. When holding it, my fingers fit right over the clickers without any strain on my hand or wrist - I also bought a gel mouse pad. I found myself having to work remote from home without a mouse for weeks with such a good solution so easy to find at less than a reasonable price. I had it out of the box and set up to go in seconds. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Catmaf

customer_reviews.title: Functional but one major comfort issue
customer_reviews.text: The edge of the top of the wheel well where the scrolling wheel is situated is too sharp. It noticeably scrapes against the bottom of my finger when I scroll up, and the sharpness is noticeable even when just resting my finger on the front of the wheel. It is not enough to be outright painful, but enough to be uncomfortable, but that's enough to make the mouse pretty worthless. Ultimately you get what you pay for, and it seems like most people like this mouse, so it may not be a big deal for others.
customer_reviews.author: Deb B.

customer_reviews.title: Changed my life!
customer_reviews.text: For so long I've just sort of 'put up' with using my touchpad mouse for picking and choosing and scrolling on my giant laptop, and it often drives me crazy. So my hubby said, I'm going to get you a wireless mouse, and Voila! It has made life SO much easier! Sometimes you think you don't need something new, and that you'll just get by. And then there's something called a wireless mouse. Ahhhhh.... I'm a happy Grandma! ;) Now go buy one!
customer_reviews.author: T. H. Maraszek

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 13 months - would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Oct 16 2016 - fine for almost 13 months. Then, I found I had to click 2-4 times to get a window to open, etc. In 20+ years his is the first mouse I have had that actually malfunctioned. The others I have replaced because my needs changed - or just because I wanted a newer mouse with more functions. While not expensive, it is inconvenient to have to shop for a new mouse. I bought a new mouse - decided to go back to Logitech - always had success with those in the past. I'll see if they have improved to the point of annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: jemsw

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Loved this TeckNet mouse at first, bought it July 2018 and worked until November 2018... only worked for 4 months! Used it for my home laptop only, which I barely use, so don't understand why the mouse stopped working. Changed the batteries, reinstalled, followed troubleshoot guide, it just simply stopped working. Too bad I cannot return it.
customer_reviews.author: miris

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 4 or 5 of this model mouse in different colors. Half of them don't work. I changed the batteries, tried them on different systems, but the mouse does not communicate with the receiver. The OS recognizes the dongle and installs the driver, but the mouse does nothing. It's hit or miss depending if the sku is M003 or D-09. The M003 isn't working for me. However, the other two work fine (one D-09 and one M003)
customer_reviews.author: Corticus

customer_reviews.title: Tecknet For Your Wireless Mouse Needs
customer_reviews.text: Hate clicking by hand on the touchpad on my laptop,so I've had a plugin mouse for a year connected. Over the past two weeks the mouse has gone haywire. God forbid I right click, it starts opening pages and links even as I just "hover" over them. So, the time was right to order a wireless mouse, which I've never owned before and quite frankly, not a big fan of. It arrived on time Saturday and took all of two minutes to install and catch the bluetooth signal. Boom! It was done. I conserve the batteries by shutting it off when not in use but it was a wonderful purchase which I highly reccommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stack

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse, I purchased it for my desk at work and it has worked out great! It's great to use, small enough to move around and the battery life lasts a long time! I use it all day at work and turn it off at the end of my work day and so I think it helps preserve it. The feel is great as well, it is my first time using an ergonomic mouse and I love it! I would recommend for at home use and also work use, however, I will say I am not sure how long the battery lasts if you do not turn it off every day.
customer_reviews.author: J.Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Terrible instructions!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday. Today only the Low Battery light works. _All_ batteries in new package bad??? Returning to buy local - easier if it messes up! Edit: instructions are bad. 'Look for an On light at top and never want to see Low Battery light'. _However_ there is no light at top and it is the Low Battery light that flashes when it is turned on. _Seems_ to be okay now. Two stars off for terrible instructions.
customer_reviews.author: K. White

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, great features, good value
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pretty pleased with this product. Its ergonomic design is comfortable. I especially like the back and forward buttons located on the side as these allow for easy navigation from page to page without ever having to move the pointer on your screen. I have had the product for almost 2 months and I'm on the original set of batteries. I have absolutely no complaints about this product and I would highly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer 002

customer_reviews.title: No lag and very quick to hook up
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wireless mouse to use with my laptop when I’m working on excel spreadsheets and things and got this one. It’s really perfect. It hooks up via a usb receiver and is an instant on when hooked up. Sometimes the wireless mice can be too sensitive or jerk the curser a bit on the screen, but this one is smooth and easy. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: LB Churchill

product_meta.title: TeckNet Pro 2.4G Ergonomic Wireless Optical Mouse with USB Nano Receiver for Laptop,PC,Computer,Chromebook,Notebook,6 Buttons,24 Months Battery Life, 2600 DPI, 5 Adjustment Levels
feature_bullets: Plug & Play - Comes with a tiny USB Nano receiver(stored within the back of the mouse) , just plug it into your PC and then forget it. 5 Adjustable DPI Level (2600/2000/1600/1200/800) - choose your own cursor speed.

2.4GHz Wireless & Ultra-durable build - 5, 000, 000 clicks lifespan. 2.4GHz wireless provides a powerful, reliable connection, increases working distance of up to 33ft/10M. Usb Nano receiver can be stored within the back

TeckNet Tru-Wave technology provides precise, smart cursor control over many surface types. TeckNet Co-Link technology – after pairing there’s no need to re-establish pairing after a signal loss or shutdown

24-Month Long battery life: with auto power-off function, on/Off switch, smart sleep mode and battery life indicator, you might just forget this mouse runs on batteries. Power by 2xAAA battery(batteries are NOT included)
Wide Compatible - Compatible with Windows XP, Vista, 7, 8, 8.1,10 and Linux. Works with Notebook,Chromebook, PC, Laptop, Computer, and more.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars14,687 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
